title: Fix auto compact - context overflow breaks conversation
description:
When the conversation runs out of context, it breaks because the webui doesn't handle auto compact.

## Problem
The Claude Code CLI usually handles auto compact automatically, but when running through the webui, context overflow breaks the conversation.

## Expected Behavior
The webui should handle context compaction gracefully, either by:
- Triggering auto-compact when approaching context limits
- Displaying a warning when context is getting full
- Gracefully handling the compact event from the SDK

## Reference
GitHub issue: sugyan/claude-code-webui#228

Add completions support (slash commands and @ mentions)
description:
Add support for completions like the terminal UI - typing `/` shows commands, `@` shows files/agents.

## Problem
The terminal UI allows typing `/` to see commands and `@` to mention files or agents. This is a major UX win that's missing from the webui.

## Proposed Solution
Implement completion support:
- `/` prefix: Show available slash commands
- `@` prefix: Show files and agents for mention

Implementation depends on what the Claude Code SDK supports:
- If SDK is "dumb": Backend endpoint for completions by type
- If SDK is "smart": Backend call exposing text and cursor location

## UI Requirements
- Dropdown/popup showing completions as user types
- Keyboard navigation (arrow keys, enter to select)
- Filter completions based on typed text

## Reference
GitHub issue: sugyan/claude-code-webui#224

title: Fix AskUserQuestion interaction not rendering
description:
When Claude triggers an AskUserQuestion interaction, the permission prompt appears but the actual question/options don't render in the WebUI. This causes the conversation to get stuck in a loop.

**GitHub Issue:** https://github.com/sugyan/claude-code-webui/issues/352

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Trigger a plan that causes Claude to use AskUserQuestion
2. Give permission when prompted
3. Observe that the question options don't appear

**Expected:** Question options should render and allow user selection.

**Workaround:** Currently requires using CLI with `claude --continue` to recover.
close_reason: Fixed with PR #3 - Added AskUserQuestion interaction support

title: Add configurable keyboard shortcuts system
description:
Implement a configurable keyboard shortcuts system for power users.

## Current Shortcuts
- Enter: Submit message (configurable via enter behavior)
- Shift+Enter: Alternative behavior
- Escape: Abort current request

## Proposed Features
- Configurable shortcuts in settings
- Permission mode toggle shortcut (Ctrl+Shift+M / Cmd+Shift+M)
- Platform-specific defaults (Ctrl vs Cmd)
- Conflict detection and warnings
- Help panel showing all shortcuts

## Technical Requirements
- Keyboard event handling with IME awareness
- Settings integration with localStorage
- Platform detection for defaults

title: Add YOLO/bypass permissions mode toggle
description:
Add a UI toggle to enable 'dangerouslySkipPermissions' / bypass permissions mode (YOLO mode).

## Context
The Claude Code SDK supports a `bypassPermissions` mode that skips permission prompts. Currently the frontend filters this out in `types.ts`:
```typescript
// Filter out bypassPermissions for UI
return sdkMode === "bypassPermissions" ? "default" : sdkMode;
```

## Requirements
- Add a toggle in settings or chat input to enable YOLO mode
- Pass `dangerouslySkipPermissions: true` to the SDK when enabled
- Add appropriate warning/confirmation before enabling
- Consider session-level vs global setting

## References
- SDK permission mode: `bypassPermissions`
- SDK option: `dangerouslySkipPermissions`
